intro: Deppea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian deppea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Deppea colombiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
